lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - A Business Dinner with a Supplier

sentence.idiomatic: The first time Chinese people meet, they like to say "pleased to meet you".

word.literal: to have the pleasure of meeting someone

sentence.idiomatic: I have wanted to have the pleasure of making your acquaintance for a long time. I am honored to be able to meet you today.
Hello Mr. Wang. I am pleased to make your acquaintance. I am very happy to meet you.
You are Mr. Li, aren't you? Very pleased to meet you!
He told me that when you meet a person for the first time, you must say "very pleased to meet you".
As soon as we met, he shook my hand and said, "Very pleased to meet you. This is the first time you have been here, isn't it?"
The mutually beneficial marketing model that this company adopted obtained great success.
During this collaboration our goal is to bring about benefits to both parties.
We must strive to obtain a mutually beneficial outcome.
He feels that this stock has the greatest potential to go up.
It is said that the potential for this area's land to increase is enormous.
In everyone's life there is the potential and opportunity for success.
The main content of today's training is how to deal with clients.
I'm not good at dealing with people. It would be better if you go.
In the wake of the reform and opening up policy, there are more and more opportunities for Chinese enterprises and foreign companies to have dealings.
What are they gesturing wildly about over there?
They keep talking on and on, using all kinds of gestures to describe the scene at that time.
The two of them are both walking and gesturing wildly as they are disputing this problem.

word.literal: to not return without getting drunk

sentence.idiomatic: Keep drinking. We said today we wouldn't go home until we got drunk.

word.literal: to not return without getting drunk

sentence.idiomatic: I have decided to allow myself to let loose for once. Tonight I won't go home until I'm drunk.

word.literal: to not return without getting drunk

sentence.idiomatic: Everybody get started. We can drink the alcohol slowly--today we won't go home until we're drunk.
Mr. Li, pleased to meet you. Now we can finally meet each other.
Hello Peter! It's great to meet you. So, how did it go? Are you satisfied with our company's samples?
Very satisfied! When the Canadian head office saw them, they couldn't stop praising them. Everyone says they'll do well on the market.
Ha ha. There's money to be made by everyone, and what we want to strive for is a win-win situation. Peter, today must give me face. Let's go for dinner together.
Thank you for your hospitality, Mr. Li! [time passes]
Come on, now! Peter, I wish us success in this joint project, and I hope that we will work together even more in the future!
Thank you, Mr. Li. Let's make a toast to our success!
OK. Cheers!
To tell the truth, Mr. Li, the tools that you manufacture have a huge potential in Canada.
Thank you, thank you. I about to ask you what the Canadian market is like. But let's chat about this after this drink to our success first.
Manager Li, I toast you. Bottoms up!
Peter, when I heard that we were going to do business with you earlier, I really thought it would be bit of a headache.
What was the matter?
Oh, the language problem! Dealing with foreigners and having to use gestures to communicate is so exhausting. I'd never have thought your Chinese would be better than mine!
I was also worried about it. I was afraid that when we started talking business, my Chinese wouldn't be good enough.
How could that be? The fact that we can work together so successfully is all due to your authentic Chinese.
You're praising me too much. Come and let's have another drink!

word.literal: to not return without getting drunk

sentence.idiomatic: OK. Today no one is going home until we're both drunk!

word.literal: to have the pleasure of meeting someone
to not return without getting drunk
